entries.name: Locations in Doomspace
entries: 下列地点在厄运空间的地图上被描绘出来。

entries.name: Eye of Doom
entries: 厄运之眼是厄运空间的太阳的残骸。这个旋转的、无光的漩涡正慢慢地把这个系统的行星、卫星和水晶碎片拉进它。每一次围绕 "厄运之眼 "的运行都会使瓦尔特、费林、马拉斯和恩的九颗卫星更接近这个漩涡。
进入漩涡的生物或物体会发生什么？这由你决定。尽管厄运空间的大多数生物都认为漩涡是一种破坏性的力量，但它可能是通往另一个维度、另一个现实或另一个威尔兹空间系统的大门。

entries.name: Valt
entries: 瓦尔特是费林的卫星之一，直到它被厄运之眼从这个星球的轨道上撕下来。它还有几天就会消失在漩涡中。

entries.name: Fyreen
entries: Fyreen是一个被龙掠夺的火山世界。这个星球剩余的资源被激烈争夺，产生了一些暴君。
太阳崩溃后，费林的温度急剧下降，但这个星球自身产生的热量足以使其不至于冻结。
当太阳崩溃时，{@creature Dohwar|BAM|dohwars}和{@creature Mercane|BAM|mercanes}（都在{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}中描述）从费林疏散了成千上万的生物。其中许多生物被安置在恩的九个卫星上（最多只能提供暂时的慰藉），或被安全地带到其他威尔兹空间系统。还有数以百万计的生物被留下，被末日之眼吞噬。
克里奥斯，费林的两颗卫星中较小的一颗，仍然围绕着这个星球运行。但是发生在瓦尔特身上的同样的事情将在大约一个月后发生在克里奥斯身上。

entries.name: Malas
entries: 马拉斯是一个水世界，现在被冰层所覆盖。它的表面覆盖着陡峭的山脉和深深的峡谷。一个月球大小的光滑冰轴被认为是行星的碎片，围绕着马拉斯运行。纺锤体上住着一个高智商但排外的民族（%0%），以及其他东西。

entries.name: Nine Moons of En
entries: 恩是一个球形的空气体--一个巨大的气体巨人。据说原始人利用恩的气体帮助制造了包围末日空间的水晶球，在这个过程中分散了恩的九个卫星。

entries.name: Aruun
entries: 这颗大卫星是猖獗的（%0%）的家。{@book Aartuks|BAM|0|Bestiary}（见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}）和其他较小的生命形式生活在阿鲁恩的岩柱和高原之上的森林里，是塔拉斯克人无法企及的。

entries.name: G'vek
entries: 这个月球上点缀着陡峭的山脉，这些山脉已经成为从费林疏散出来的阿拉科克拉家族的家。{@creature B'rohg|BAM|B'rohgs}（见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}）、{@creature Death Dog||death dogs}、{@creature Gorgon||gorgons}、{@creature Hydra||hydras}和其他怪物在山脚下徘徊。

entries.name: Inivar
entries: 伊尼瓦尔是一个多色气体的漩涡球。一种强烈的、闪烁的光从月球的核心发出，形成一种天体的灯塔。

entries.name: Lesk
entries: 恩的九个卫星中最大的卫星是一片黑暗的沙漠。在这里，{@book ssurran|BAM|0|Bestiary}(见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM})的部族艰难地生存着。

entries.name: Shalar
entries: 沙拉尔是一颗冰月，有一圈冰晶环绕着它的赤道。从费林疏散出来的人类在沙拉尔的极地冰盖上建起了大型营地，恐龙在冰天雪地中游荡，以稀少的植被和彼此为食。

entries.name: Thrydd
entries: 深邃的峡谷在这个巨大的冰球的表面纵横交错。峡谷被热喷口加热，居住着（%0%）、*（%1%）、*（%2%）、*（%3%）、（%4%）、*和（%5%）。(标有星号的生物将在{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}中描述。)

entries.name: Vocath
entries: 这个完全由有毒的绿色气体组成的月亮，在{@area chapters 8|0da|x}和{@area 9|101|x}中出现。

entries.name: Yisheen
entries: 这个小而贫瘠的月亮上覆盖着黑色的霜，属于Yisheen，一个吝啬的{@creature adult lunar dragon|BAM}（见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}），不遵守律师的规定。

entries.name: Yort
entries: 这个寒冷的沼泽月球上散布着{@creature kindori|BAM}的石化骨架（见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}）。从费林疏散出来的人形生物已经开始在尸骨中建造避难所。

entries.name: Shattered Sphere
entries: 烟灰色的水晶碎片，每一块都有一英里厚，数百英里长，漂浮在末日空间的最外层区域。这些碎片是曾经包围整个威尔兹空间系统的巨大水晶球的全部残骸。当时，这个球体被认为是不可摧毁的，但显然事实并非如此。各种各样的生物都曾试图收获水晶，但却发现它无法被任何已知的魔法或力量削去或打破。

entries.name: Chapter 8: Arena of Blood

entries: {@i Eager to join a coalition against the Xaryxian Empire, the characters arrived in Doomspace to find the system on the verge of collapse. Commodore Krux led his crew to Aruun with the goal of finding an old comrade named Warwyck Blastimoff, who was tasked with organizing a coalition in advance of taking the fight to the enemy}!
上一环节结束时出现的两个（%0%）可以进行战斗，或者人物可以撤退到安全的飞船中。
在感谢这些人物的及时救援后，{@creature Warwyck Blastimoff|LoX}告诉他们，打败夏里安帝国的联盟并不存在，但一个名叫{@creature Vocath|LoX}的雇佣军火商可能是创建联盟的关键。
如果人物想组成一个联盟，他们必须先说服{@creature Vocath|LoX}，让他讨债。各个空间居住派别的领导人都对{@creature Vocath|LoX}心存芥蒂，因此愿意听从他的意见，他们指挥的法术干扰船足以组成一支舰队。为了获得{@creature Vocath|LoX}的帮助，人物必须在角斗场上表演，供他取乐，从而赢得雇佣兵的尊重。

entries.name: What Coalition?
entries: 一旦他安全地离开阿鲁恩，沃里克就解释了目前末日空间的情况。
"我建立一个联盟的努力并不成功。厄运空间的各派别对与夏里安帝国作战的兴趣不大，夏里安帝国对他们来说似乎只是一个遥远的威胁。他们更愿意在自己之间战斗。你们自己也看到了阿尔图克人是多么的刺耳。我的和平恳求似乎已经冒犯了他们。
"这些派别似乎唯一的共同点是他们对船只、法术干扰头盔和武器的渴求--这些东西我都无法提供。战争是这里每个人的母语，而最精通战争的是雇佣兵。蓝巨人通过向其他派别出售船只、头盔和武器以换取原始矿物资源而大赚一笔。
"但是，一切还没有失去。我了解到，各派系都欠了一个叫（%0%）的雇佣兵的债。他可能愿意帮助我们......但要付出代价。"

entries.name: Questioning Warwyck
entries: 对{@creature Vocath|LoX}有疑问的角色可以从华威公司获得以下信息。

items.name: Vocath the Mercane
items.entry: {@creature Vocath|LoX}从注定失败的费林世界疏散了数百名阿拉科克拉人、人类、特里格林人和苏兰人，然后以几乎零的价格向他们出售船只和{@item Spelljamming Helm|AAG|spelljamming helms}。所有的派别都在努力争取他的青睐。

items.name: Vocath's Base
items.entry: {@creature Vocath|LoX}有一个基地，绕着恩的九个卫星之一运行。他用自己的名字给这个月亮重新命名。(人物可以用他们的{@item Wildspace orrery|AAG}来确定从阿鲁恩到{@creature Vocath|LoX}需要3天的时间来乘坐法术干扰船，因为这两个卫星目前相距3亿英里。)

items.name: Vocath's Arena
items.entry: {@creature Vocath|LoX}喜欢血腥的运动，他的基地里有一个角斗场，冠军们在那里与{@creature Vocath|LoX}从费林运来的可怕的生物进行战斗。各个派别派出他们最伟大的战士在竞技场上战斗，以引起{@creature Vocath|LoX}的注意或赢得物资、武器或两者。

entries.name: Vocath's Base
entries: 从阿鲁恩到{@creature Vocath|LoX}的三天旅程并不顺利，{@creature Commodore Krux|LoX}花了很多时间与他的好朋友沃里克叙旧。观察这两个人的人物注意到，Warwyck的出现让克鲁克斯精神大振，让这位准将充满了希望和乐观。
当人物到达{@creature Vocath|LoX}的基地时，阅读。
漂浮在{@creature Vocath|LoX}发光的绿色云层之上的是一个由灰色和黑色石头组成的结构，底部有大型的水晶阵突起。码头从一个由水晶圆顶覆盖的建筑物向外辐射。这里停泊着几艘船，包括一艘大帆船和另外四艘，它们的形状分别是黄蜂、蝎子、灯鱼和鸟。
与主楼相连的是一座塔，塔顶附近有自己的私人码头。在这个码头的尽头有一艘船，形状像一只豆娘，其金属船身涂成亮蓝色。在这个码头的两侧有两个相同的40英尺高的雕像，每个雕像都描绘了一个瘦小的、蓝色的、穿着整齐的巨人。

Aarakocra, aartuks, humans, ssurran, and thri-kreen的船员们聚集在他们的船只附近的码头上，在等待下一轮角斗游戏开始的时候，他们保持沉默。七个{@creature Githyanki Warrior||githyanki warriors}（见下文{@area "Tattooed Guards"|0e1|x}）让船员们不要互相争斗。守卫和船员们对新来的人漠不关心。
码头在{@area accompanying map of Vocath's base|0df|x}上被编号为1至8。1到7号码头，供游客使用，位于基地的重力面。8号船坞是雇佣军的私人设施。
以下船只，每艘都配备了{@item spelljamming helm|AAG}，当人物到达时，它们都停靠在{@creature Vocath|LoX}的基地。

items.name: Dock 1
items.entry: Skyrra，一个{@vehicle shrike ship|AAG}，有11个{@creature aarakocra}和一个{@creature aarakocra spelljammer|LoX}的船员（使用{@creature mage}的状态块，但给这个arakocra的飞行速度为50英尺）。

items.name: Dock 2
items.entry: 雷莫拉号是一艘{@vehicle lamprey ship|AAG}，有12名{@creature Aartuk Weedling|BAM|aartuk weedlings}、3名{@creature Aartuk Starhorror|BAM|aartuk starhorrors}和1名{@creature aartuk elder|BAM}的船员（他们的状态块见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}）。

items.name: Dock 4
items.entry: 塔拉斯克（Tarrasque）是一个（%0%），有一群哈多兹人（四个（%1%），十五个（%2%），一个哈多兹人（%3%））。

items.name: Dock 5
items.entry: Gadabout是一个腿部被撕裂的{@vehicle wasp ship|AAG}，有两个{@creature Ssurran Defiler|BAM|ssurran defilers}和三个{@creature Ssurran Poisoner|BAM|ssurran poisoners}的船员（见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}的状态块）。它的货舱已经变成了一个苏兰蛋的育婴室。

items.name: Dock 6
items.entry: Vrusk是一个{@vehicle scorpion ship|AAG}，有8名{@creature Thri-kreen Hunter|BAM|thri-kreen hunters}、3名{@creature Thri-kreen Gladiator|BAM|thri-kreen gladiators}和1名{@creature thri-kreen mystic|BAM}的船员，他们担任法术干扰者（见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}的状态块）。

items.name: Dock 8
items.entry: {@creature Vocath|LoX}的游艇，一艘名为 "魔鬼交易 "的{@vehicle damselfly ship|AAG}，停泊在这个码头的尽头。关于这艘船和它的船员的更多信息，见本章后面的{@area area 6|0f3|x}。

entries: 3号码头和7号码头没有船只。如果人物在{@i Second Wind}号上旅行，并且克鲁克斯是指挥官，他选择将船停泊在3号码头。如果人物在{@i Last Breath}号上旅行，并且Gargenhale是指挥官，他选择将船只停泊在7号码头。
Krux、Gargenhale、{@creature Topolah|LoX}和Flinch留在船上，而人物处理与{@creature Vocath|LoX}的谈判。Warwyck提出加入角色，如果他们要求，他将在{@creature Vocath|LoX}的竞技场与他们一起战斗。{@creature Princess Xedalli|LoX}也想加入角色，但她不会参加竞技场的战斗。

entries.name: Tattooed Guards
entries: {@creature Vocath|LoX}雇佣了吉夫和吉蒂扬基的卫兵，他们每个人的右手背上都纹有佣人的个人标志。拥有这个标记可以让持有者绕过某些安全功能（见下面的 "魔法效果"）。作为一项行动，(1%)标志的持有者可以用这个纹身来施展(2%)的法术，只与(3%)沟通。

entries.name: Magical Effects
entries: 在{@creature Vocath|LoX}的基础上有几个神奇的效果。

items.name: Extended Telepathy
items.entry: {@creature Vocath|LoX}可以与基地上任何{@creature Vocath|LoX}可以看到或有{@creature Vocath|LoX}个人标志纹身的生物建立心灵感应。

items.name: Lighting
items.entry: {@creature Vocath|LoX}的基地里，有{@spell continual flame}的法术的钎子、灯和壁炉，光线明亮。

items.name: Walls of Force
items.entry: 透明、隔音的力墙将（%0%）、（%1%）和（%2%）分开。{@creature Vocath|LoX}可以通过这些魔法屏障，被纹上他个人标志的生物也可以。{@creature Vocath|LoX}可以压制或重新激活这些墙之一（不需要行动），即使他看不到它。否则，任何东西都无法通过这些墙。一个{@spell disintegrate}的法术可以摧毁一堵力墙；否则，一堵墙是不可摧毁的，不能被驱散。

entries.name: Where's Vocath?
entries: 当人物第一次到达{@creature Vocath|LoX}的基地时，{@creature mercane|BAM}(见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM})正在他的觐见室({@area area 4|0ec|x})，由他的私人保镖陪同。Y'thraka，一个带着眼罩的快乐的合法中立者（%4%），和Burt Fluke中士，一个满嘴脏话的混乱中立者（%5%）（见（%6%））。无论他走到哪里，这两个人都会陪伴他。
当{@creature Vocath|LoX}决定举行角斗士比赛时，他通知基地的其他警卫，让他们把观众赶到竞技场的阳台上（{@area area 1|0e5|x}）。{@creature Vocath|LoX}和他的保镖们随后转移到雇佣兵的私人观礼台上，俯瞰竞技场，在那里{@creature Vocath|LoX}主持比赛。
如果{@creature Vocath|LoX}处于危险之中，他的保镖会护送他到停泊在{@area area 6|0f3|x}的{@vehicle damselfly ship|AAG}，雇佣兵会用它来逃离威胁。

entries.name: Vocath's Base Locations
entries: 在{@creature Vocath|LoX}的基地地图上描绘了以下地点。

entries.name: 1: Arena
entries: 竞技场是一个60英尺高的八角室，头顶上有一个水晶穹顶。地板上铺满了沙子，这里有一些破碎的、无法使用的武器和大块的石头。

entries.name: Balcony
entries: 一个石头阳台环绕着房间，离地面30英尺。这个阳台是观众聚集在一起观看竞技场战斗的地方。

entries.name: Private Box
entries: 比主阳台高20英尺，离竞技场地面50英尺的地方，是一个私人包厢，{@creature Vocath|LoX}在这里观看比赛，他的两个保镖在旁边陪同。这里有一个为佣人准备的华丽的宝座，两边各有两把小椅子供贵宾坐。在王座后面，一道闪闪发光的力量墙（见上面的1%）填满了通往2区的拱门。

entries.name: Treasure
entries: 安装在{@creature Vocath|LoX}的私人盒子下面，竞技场地板上的生物可以看到，是一个{@item mirror of life trapping}，其命令词只有{@creature Vocath|LoX}知道。雇佣兵在镜子里困住了以下生物，并在本章后面的{@area "Arena Battles"|0f9|x}事件中释放了其中一些：一个{@creature braxat|BAM}、*两个{@creature B'rohg|BAM|b'rohgs}、*两个{@creature Hook Horror||hook horrors}、一个{@creature megapede|BAM}、*一个{@creature brown scavver|BAM}、*一个{@creature gray scavver|BAM}、*三个{@creature Space Clown|BAM|space clowns}和一个{@creature space guppy|BAM}*（带星号的生物将在{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}中描述。） 以这种方式释放的生物会在竞技场地板上无人的地方变现，尽可能靠近镜子。如果镜子被打碎了，所有被困在里面的生物都会被一次性释放。

entries.name: 2: Armory
entries: 两道力墙（见上面的"{@area Magical Effects|0e2|x}"）封住了这个密室，三个{@creature Giff Shipmate|BAM|giff shipmates}（见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}）和三个{@creature Githyanki Warrior||githyanki warriors}在这里站岗。装有盔甲和武器的架子被安装在他们身后的墙上（见下文 "宝藏"）。

entries.name: Treasure
entries: 武器架和架子上可以放十个{@item Longsword|PHB|longswords}、十套{@item Half Plate Armor|PHB|half plate}、四个{@item Musket||muskets}、四个{@item Pistol||pistols}、两百颗子弹、二十个{@item Bomb||bombs}和五个{@item Gunpowder Keg||kegs of gunpowder}（关于火器、炸弹和火药的更多信息，见{@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}中的"{@book Explosives|DMG|9|Explosives}"）。

entries.name: 3: Vestibule
entries: 从码头的石板坡道上升到这个前庭，那里的力墙（见上面的"（%0%）"）挡住了通往2号和4号区域的通道。两个{@creature Giff Shipmate|BAM|giff shipmates}(见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM})和两个{@creature Githyanki Warrior||githyanki warriors}守住前庭。
寻求觐见{@creature Vocath|LoX}的访客应在此等候，直到佣人允许他们进入他的觐见室（4区）。

entries.name: 4: Audience Chamber

entries: 这个圆形密室的入口对面有一个华丽的宝座，墙上挂着艺术品、挂毯、绘画和陈列的武器。
一道力墙填满了通往3号区域的拱门（见上文"（%0%）"）。

entries.name: Teleporter
entries: 当他在这个房间里时，{@creature Vocath|LoX}可以采取一个行动，将他在房间里看到的任何数量的生物传送到竞技场的地板上（{@area area 1|0e5|x}）或传送到他的塔楼圣地（5区）。

entries.name: Treasure
entries: 展出了30个来自多元宇宙的著名人物的彩绘雕像（每个25金币），6个展示各种姿势和表情的（%0%）蓝色石英半身像（每个250金币），8艘模型船（每个750金币），以及4幅精致的挂毯（每个750金币）和4幅居住在太空的动物画（每个750金币）。架子上放着华丽的武器和盔甲，包括一套（%%1%）和一套（%%2%）。{@creature Vocath|LoX}愿意以每件2500金币的价格出售这些魔法物品，或者用其中任何一件换取另一件稀有的魔法物品。
如果除了{@creature Vocath|LoX}以外的生物触碰了任何展示的物品，一个精神警报就会提醒{@creature Vocath|LoX}，让他知道哪个物品被触碰。

entries.name: 5: Vocath's Sanctum

entries: 这间50英尺高的房间四周都有丝质的窗户，可以看到下面发光的云层和遥远的黑暗虚空，那曾经是杜姆空间的太阳。整个房间里播放着柔和的音乐。地板上散布着低矮的桌子，上面放着茶点。每张桌子的中间都有一个坚固的基座，上面有一个青色的{@creature Vocath|LoX}的半身像。
一扇没有上锁的石门通向{@creature Vocath|LoX}的私人码头（6区）。房间里弥漫的音乐是由魔法创造的。(1%)可以随意改变音乐并控制其音量（不需要任何行动）。

entries.name: Teleporter
entries: 在这个房间里，{@creature Vocath|LoX}可以使用一个动作将他所选择的、在房间里能看到的任何数量的生物传送到4区。一个生物可以通过成功地进行DC14的 "魅力储蓄 "来否定这个效果。

entries.name: 6: Private Dock
entries: 一个私人码头从{@creature Vocath|LoX}的塔楼上伸出来，高出公共码头80英尺。码头的底部是一个固定在塔上的宽大平台。一扇没有上锁的石门通向第5区，由两个（%%1%）（见（%%2%））守卫，他们站在两个40英尺高的（%%3%）石像之间。

entries.name: Devil's Deal
entries: {@creature Vocath|LoX}的{@vehicle damselfly ship|AAG}，"魔鬼的交易"，停泊在码头的尽头。这艘船的船员包括{@creature Vocath|LoX}的两名私人卫兵（见上面的"{@area Where's Vocath?|0e3|x}"），五名{@creature Githyanki Buccaneer|BAM|githyanki buccaneers}，以及一名{@creature githyanki xenomancer|BAM}，他在{@creature Vocath|LoX}不想驾驶这艘船时负责驾驶（见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}关于吉蒂扬基的数据块）。{@creature Vocath|LoX}把船的货舱变成了他的私人寝室。

entries.name: Treasure
entries: 恶魔交易号上的{@item spelljamming helm|AAG}是一把由石化木头雕刻而成的无腿椅子。凹形座椅底部的黑色晶体在地板上投射出一圈紫色的光，在稳定舵手的同时，也使其能够旋转。
搜索{@creature Vocath|LoX}寝室的人物会发现一个折叠起来的{@item portable hole}，里面藏有500pp和13颗宝石（每个价值100gp的刚玉）。

entries.name: Meeting Vocath
entries: 要与{@creature Vocath|LoX}交谈，人物必须先与他的一个或多个卫兵互动，卫兵会用他们的标志纹身来联系雇佣兵，并告知他人物的到来。{@creature Vocath|LoX}有兴趣听这些人物说些什么，他指示卫兵把他们带到觐见室（{@area area 4|0ec|x}），在那里{@creature Vocath|LoX}迎接他们。
{@creature Vocath|LoX}，一个身材修长的蓝色巨人，穿着优雅的长袍，坐在一个大宝座上，两边是两个保镖：一个战痕累累的吉夫和一个带着眼罩的吉特安基。两人都身穿板甲。
"我不能说你看起来特别重要，"雇佣兵抽泣道。"那就说吧。不要浪费我的时间。"
{@creature Vocath|LoX}是冷酷的，自以为是的，并渗入了骄傲。他知道厄运空间的所有派别都在为取悦他而竞争。他对厄运空间各派别结盟的情感恳求不屑一顾，就像他对任何不给他带来利润的东西一样。
如果人物提到与Xaryxian帝国的冲突，{@creature Vocath|LoX}的举止会变得冷淡，因为他认为这不是一个对他有利的结局。如果Xedalli在场，{@creature Vocath|LoX}会认为她要么是人物的囚犯，要么是Xaryxian帝国的叛徒；就她而言，Xedalli会听从人物的安排，隐瞒她的身份，或者根据情况公开她的皇家头衔。
如果人物恳求{@creature Vocath|LoX}的帮助，请阅读。
"受够了'我、我、我'，"{@creature Vocath|LoX}说。他眼中闪过一丝鄙夷，补充道："如果你能在我的竞技场上活过三场战斗，中间没有休息，我就为你安排一次与各派别领导人的私人会面。各个派别的代表都会关注，所以要好好打。优秀的表现可能会赢得他们的青睐。"
如果人物同意他的条件，{@creature Vocath|LoX}会做一个轻蔑的手势，把人物传送到竞技场({@area area 1|0e5|x})，然后去他的私人包厢看他们表演。如果{@creature Princess Xedalli|LoX}在场，{@creature Vocath|LoX}会邀请她加入他的私人包厢，在他身边观看表演--她礼貌地接受了这个提议。

entries.name: Arena Battles
entries: 在把人物传送到竞技场后，雇佣兵指示他的卫兵把观众引到周围的阳台上，他们开始欢呼，期待着即将到来的奇观。{@creature Vocath|LoX}在他的私人阳台上向众人致意。在第一个挑战开始之前，角色们有1分钟的准备时间。
角色在每场比赛开始时滚动主动权，他们在比赛之间没有时间休息。在比赛中，将对方的所有战斗人员减少到0点的一方将获得胜利。

entries.name: Match 1: Thrasher and Gnasher
entries: 两个（%0%）（见（%1%））出现在竞技场上。他们站在15英尺高的地方，有着焦橙色的皮肤，在观众兴奋的尖叫声中显得有些茫然。
在适应突如其来的骚动和新的环境时，b'rohgs在主动性卷轴上有劣势。散落在竞技场地板上的石头足够大，可以作为远程武器使用。

entries.name: Match 2: Brutus the Braxat
entries: 布鲁特斯，一个{@creature braxat|BAM}，与一个{@creature brown scavver|BAM}和一个{@creature gray scavver|BAM}（见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}的状态块）一起。他们作为盟友作战。

entries.name: Match 3: Queen Gorma

entries: {@creature Vocath|LoX}喊道，"做得好。现在你们准备好迎接末日空间的恐怖吧！"
不知从哪里来的，一个三英尺长、睁大眼睛的太空豚出现在你面前，友好地摇晃着尾巴。
人物有片刻的时间来评估他们的敌人--一个{@creature space guppy|BAM}（见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}）--然后{@creature Vocath|LoX}才意识到，他释放了错误的生物，这让他感到很沮丧。意识到自己的错误后，{@creature Vocath|LoX}把他的手臂扔到空中，说："原谅我。让我们再试一次。"
戈尔玛女王，一个一百英尺长的{@creature megapede|BAM}(见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM})出现了，抢走了古比，并把它整个吞下。与此同时，人群中有人喊道："戈尔玛! 戈尔马! 戈尔马！" 这只巨兽并不挑食，不分青红皂白地瞄准敌人。

entries.name: Xeleth's Big Entrance
entries: 当最后一场竞技场比赛结束时，但在人物有时间休息或采取任何进一步行动之前，请阅读。
竞技场上方的部分穹顶碎裂，惊动了观众，导致水晶碎片像雨一样落下。一条长着闪烁的鳞片和模糊的翅膀的蛇形龙从洞中掠下。骑在它背上的是一个身穿铠甲的人，他的脸被藏在面罩后面。
这个身影叫道："我是Xaryxian帝国的（%0%）。我是来找我的妹妹，Xedalli。把她交给我，你们这些鼠辈，否则就会被消灭。"
{@i Here ends chapter 8.}

entries.name: Chapter 9: Discord and Diplomacy

entries: {@i To build a coalition against the Xaryxian Empire, the characters came to terms with a mercane named Vocath and fought monsters for his amusement. At the end of the final battle, Prince Xeleth of the Xaryxian Empire appeared on a dragon, determined to take Princess Xedalli into his clutches}!

会议开始时，{@creature Princess Xedalli|LoX}试图保持她的希望，同时保护她周围的人免受她哥哥{@creature Prince Xeleth|LoX}的愤怒，他已经把{@creature Vocath|LoX}的基地包围了。Xeleth为他的妹妹而来。如果Xedalli已经死亡或被认为已经死亡，获得她的{@item ring of shooting stars}（象征着她对Xaryxian王位的权利）就足以让Xeleth满意，因为他可以用它作为Xedalli死亡的证据。
如果Xeleth获得了Xedalli的监护权，或者声称戒指是她死亡的证据，那么他的舰队就会撤出末日空间，允许人物重新努力，联合末日空间各派别对抗Xaryxian帝国。Xeleth对{@creature Vocath|LoX}基地的攻击证明了星际精灵所带来的威胁，使各派别有了共同的敌人。

entries.name: The Xaryxian Threat
entries: {@creature Prince Xeleth|LoX}是一个戴着{@item ring of shooting stars}的混乱邪恶{@creature astral elf aristocrat|BAM}（见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}）。在得知他的妹妹从拘留所逃出后，Xeleth利用星界字体（见（%4%））的力量施展了（%5%）。这个法术使他能够确定他妹妹的下落（%6%）。

在上一回合结束时出现的{@creature young solar dragon|BAM}（见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}）是由Xeleth用召唤太阳龙召唤出来的。然而，骑着龙的身影并不是Xeleth本人，而是他的一个幻象，由Xeleth的{@spell mislead}法术创造。只要他保持对咒语的专注，Xeleth就可以通过这个幻象与在场的任何人互动。如果人物攻击虚幻的Xeleth或龙，龙会进行报复。

entries.name: Star Moth Fleet
entries: 真正的Xeleth安全地在{@i Xaryxia}号上，这是围绕{@creature Vocath|LoX}号基地的12个{@vehicle Star Moth|AAG|star moths}之一。星际飞蛾在基地周围形成了一个包围圈，同时与基地保持250英尺的距离。它们的武器向任何试图离开基地的飞船开火。(参见{@book Astral Adventurer's Guide|AAG}的{@vehicle Star Moth|AAG|chapter 2}，了解有关星蛾和它们的武器装备的信息。)

如果角色决定攻击Xeleth的舰队，请使用非玩家角色，如{@creature Commodore Krux|LoX}、{@creature Warwyck Blastimoff|LoX}、{@creature Princess Xedalli|LoX}和{@creature Vocath|LoX}，以表明这样做无异于自杀。每只星蛾都有一个{@creature astral elf honor guard|BAM}，作为船长；一个{@creature astral elf star priest|BAM}，作为船上的法术师；和11个{@creature Astral Elf Warrior|BAM|astral elf warriors}。舰队由一个叫Vael的（%7%）指挥，他也是Xeleth在（%8%）号上的保镖。(见{@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}的{@book astral elves' stat blocks|BAM|0|Bestiary}。)

entries.name: Vocath's Reaction
entries: 恼火的是，角色们把{@creature Prince Xeleth|LoX}的舰队带到了他家门口，{@creature Vocath|LoX}竭力阻止角色们把他拖入与Xaryxian帝国的冲突中，首先坚持让角色们遵守Xeleth的要求，然后劝阻Doomspace派系不要做任何可能使他基地目前的冲突升级的事情。如果塞达利在他身边，雇佣兵会悄悄地、有礼貌地建议她不战而降，向她哥哥投降。

entries.name: Roleplaying Xeleth and Xedalli
entries: 如果人物问Xeleth为什么要他的妹妹，他回答说。
"我们的父亲已经死了。当我成为皇帝时，我希望我的妹妹能出席我的加冕仪式。"
Xavan皇帝去世的消息对{@creature Princess Xedalli|LoX}来说并不意外。但她很了解她的哥哥，认为他对其余的事情并不完全是真实的。Xedalli澄清了Xeleth的动机，对{@creature Vocath|LoX}和人物做了这样的回答。
"在Xaryxian帝国，并非所有人都支持Xeleth的王位要求。他需要我使之合法化，防止可能发生的任何动乱。没有关系。我看我别无选择，只能和我哥哥一起回家了。"

Xeleth没有否认他姐姐的指责，她的话也没有改变目前的情况。Xedalli认为除了陪她哥哥回到Xaryxispace之外没有更好的选择。然而，随着遭遇的展开，她使用了与Xeleth相同的招数：她施展了{@spell mislead}，转身{@condition invisible}，同时创造了一个虚幻的自己的副本。当{@condition invisible}时，Xedalli通过她的幻象向人物讲话，赞扬他们的英雄态度，同时劝阻他们不要参与Xaryxian的政治。在她的幻象喋喋不休的时候，Xedalli偷偷地取下她的{@item ring of shooting stars}，把它丢在沙质的竞技场地板上，并使用{@spell sending}法术把以下信息传达给一个她可以信任的人物，让他根据这些信息采取行动。
"你需要我的戒指来拯救你的世界。我把戒指掉在沙子里了。请保管好它。我会在Xaryxispace等你。"
在放弃她的戒指后，Xedalli移回她的幻象所占据的空间，并结束她的{@spell mislead}咒语，让人觉得她一直都在那里。

在与她的戒指分手后，塞达利向她的兄弟投降。如果Xeleth的太阳龙还在，它就会把她安全地带到{@i Xaryxia}，在那里她会被拘留。如果人物打败了Xeleth的龙，Xedalli就会骑着她为自己召唤的另一条太阳龙前往她哥哥的船上。在他的妹妹登上{@i Xaryxia}号之后，Xeleth命令他的舰队返回Xaryxispace。只要Xedalli是他的俘虏，Xeleth就不会关心她的戒指会发生什么。

如果他认为Xedalli已经死了，Xeleth就会认为这些人物拥有她的戒指，并要求把它扔进他的龙的嘴里（这样龙就可以安全地把它运回Xeleth的船上）。如果他的龙在运送戒指之前被打败，Xeleth命令指挥官Vael带着八个{@creature Astral Elf Warrior|BAM|astral elf warriors}传送到{@creature Vocath|LoX}的基地，不惜一切代价获得戒指，然后传送回Xaryxia号。{@creature Vocath|LoX}，如果他还活着，就帮助星际精灵们取回戒指。他希望他们之后能平静地离开，而他们也确实如此。

entries.name: Xeleth Denied
entries: 如果Xeleth无法获得Xedalli或她的戒指，他的舰队会向停靠在{@creature Vocath|LoX}基地的船只开火。(这些船在{@area chapter 8|0d6|x}中详细说明)。经过5轮轰炸，以下船只在船员能够进行防御之前就被摧毁：{@vehicle Shrike Ship|AAG|Skyrra}号、{@vehicle Lamprey Ship|AAG|Remora}号、{@vehicle Scorpion Ship|AAG|Vrusk}号、{@vehicle Space Galleon|AAG|Tarrasque}号和{@vehicle Wasp Ship|AAG|Gadabout}号。
在最初的轰炸中，人物的船和{@i Devil's Deal}({@creature Vocath|LoX}的{@vehicle damselfly ship|AAG})都没有受损。但如果任何一艘船试图离开{@creature Vocath|LoX}的基地，星界精灵就会对逃跑的船发动下一波弹幕和芒格石。
在星界精灵最初的轰炸之后，{@creature Vocath|LoX}施展{@spell dimension door}，登上了Xeleth的旗舰，就结束冲突进行谈判。如果Xedalli在附近，雇佣兵会带上她，他们一起达成协议，Xedalli向Xeleth投降，而星界精灵也会离开，不会再有什么意外。

如果{@creature Vocath|LoX}不在身边，无法通过谈判和平结束冲突，一旦安全，Xeleth的舰队就会停靠在基地并部署军队。敌人的领导人被围捕并被处决，在末日空间各派别之间形成联盟的任何希望都已破灭。(跳过 "末日空间的联盟 "和"{@area Assemble the Fleet!|119|x} "部分）。当人物准备好离开末日空间时，继续本章末尾的"{@area Red Dragon Rider|11a|x} "部分。

entries.name: Alliance in Doomspace
entries: 在Xeleth被安抚后，他的舰队撤出了末日空间，{@creature Vocath|LoX}在他的私人圣地（{@creature Vocath|LoX}基地的{@area area 5|0f0|x}，如{@area chapter 8|0e4|x}中所述）安排了一次聚会。参加这次会议的有末日空间五个派别的人物和代表。{@creature Vocath|LoX}和他的保镖也在这里，默默地观察着会议进程。
为了建立一个联盟，角色们必须将各派别的敌意转移到夏里安帝国身上。他们必须与之对话的代表在派别代表表中有所概述。

entries.name: Forming a Coalition
entries: 一个派别对党的态度取决于人物所取得的成就。

items: 其中两个派别（由你决定）由于在竞技场战斗中的胜利而对这些角色友好。其余三个派别对角色无动于衷。
如果人物做了任何与某一派别对立的事情，该派别就会对他们产生敌意，不管他们在竞技场战斗中的表现如何。
人物可以通过影响一个派别的代表来改善该派别对他们的态度（见下面的（%0%）部分）。角色们最好的希望是让各派别联合起来对抗他们共同的敌人--夏里安帝国。

entries: To convince a faction to join the coalition, a character must make a case to the faction's representative and succeed on a Charisma check using {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Persuasion}, as befits the approach. Another character can use the {@action Help} action to grant advantage on the check, but only if that character makes a meaningful contribution to the conversation. The difficulty of the check depends on the faction's attitude toward the characters: DC 20 if hostile, DC 15 if indifferent, or DC 10 if friendly.

On a successful check, the faction joins the coalition. On a failed check, the representative declines to join the coalition, and the characters can't change that representative's mind until they convince another faction to join the coalition (discounting any factions that have already joined). The "Vortshu and T'kitka at {@creature Vocath|LoX}" sidebar shows these rules in play.

entries.name: Vortshu and T'kitka at Vocath
entries: The following is an example of the "Forming a Coalition" rules in play.

A character approaches Vortshu, the {@creature aartuk elder|BAM} (who is indifferent toward them), and tries to convince Vortshu that war against the Xaryxian Empire would give the aartuks new worlds to conquer. It's a sound approach, given aartuks' devotion to gods of war. But the character gets a failure on their DC 15 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, so Vortshu refuses to join the coalition, perhaps making the argument that the thri-kreen are a greater threat to the aartuks than the Xaryxian Empire. Further attempts to sway Vortshu fail automatically until the characters convince another faction representative to join their coalition. Having previously won over the aarakocra, the characters now set their sights on T'kitka, the thri-kreen representative.

Like Vortshu, T'kitka is indifferent toward the characters. To improve T'kitka's attitude, the characters give her the {@item spelljamming helm|AAG} they took from the {@i Dark Star} in {@area chapter 2|04b|x}. This fabulous gift is enough to improve T'kitka's attitude to friendly. A character then succeeds on the DC 10 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, convincing T'kitka to join their coalition. With the thri-kreen now on board, the characters can make another attempt to convince Vortshu to join the coalition.

entries.name: Faction Representatives
entries: Each faction leader is described below.

entries.name: Dakaer
entries: {@i Hadozee Representative}
Dakaer commands the {@i Tarrasque}, a {@vehicle space galleon|AAG}. He often sounds terse, even when he is speaking unemotionally. He and his crew dress plainly and wield weapons made from bone.
War is not something Dakaer longs for, but he seeks to acquire better weaponry nonetheless. His crew also clamors for healing kits, tools, and musical instruments.

entries.name: Attitude Adjustment
entries: The characters can improve the attitude of the hadozee faction by one step if they offer Dakaer a worthy gift, such as one of the following items:

items: A set of artisan's tools or {@item navigator's tools|PHB}
A {@item Healer's Kit|PHB|healing kit} or {@item potion of healing}
A musical instrument
A magic weapon

entries.name: Rika
entries: {@i Aarakocra Representative}
Rika is the oldest crew member of the {@vehicle shrike ship|AAG} {@i Skyrra} and chief advisor to its captain, Kree'esh.
Rika's faction is concerned about personal freedom. Rika looks forward to guiding his people to a new Wildspace system where they can thrive.

entries.name: Attitude Adjustment
entries: Characters can improve the attitude of the aarakocra faction to friendly if they offer Rika a worthy gift, such as one of the following items:

items: The {@item Wildspace orrery|AAG} acquired from {@creature Topolah|LoX}
A navigational chart for another Wildspace system

entries.name: T'kitka
entries: {@i Thri-kreen Representative}

T'kitka serves as the spelljammer aboard the {@vehicle scorpion ship|AAG} {@i Vrusk} and is keen to acquire more {@item Spelljamming Helm|AAG|spelljamming helms} and food supplies for her faction. She admits that the thri-kreen have taken to eating aartuks because of the scarcity of food in Doomspace (which hasn't endeared the thri-kreen to the aartuk faction).

entries.name: Attitude Adjustment
entries: Characters can improve the attitude of the thri-kreen faction to friendly if they offer T'kitka a worthy gift, examples of which are as follows:

items: A {@item spelljamming helm|AAG}
At least 30 days' worth of food

entries.name: Vortshu
entries: {@i Aartuk Representative}

Vortshu, the captain of the {@vehicle lamprey ship|AAG} {@i Remora}, is a warmonger who instigated a conflict with the thri-kreen. The thri-kreen have since acquired a taste for aartuk flesh. Characters can appeal to Vortshu's adversarial nature to win his support.

entries.name: Attitude Adjustment
entries: A character can improve the attitude of the aartuk faction to friendly in one of the following ways:

items: By challenging the thri-kreen representative to a duel (which T'kitka declines, but the challenge alone is enough to win over Vortshu)
By defeating Vortshu in a wrestling match, which requires the character to succeed on three DC 14 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks before failing three of those checks

entries.name: Zoth'ess
entries: {@i Ssurran Representative}
The ssurran of Fyreen are acclimating to life in Wildspace. Their leader, Zoth'ess, commands the {@vehicle wasp ship|AAG} {@i Gadabout}.
Zoth'ess needs money to repair her ship's broken leg and pay off debts to {@creature Vocath|LoX}. She demands treasure in exchange for her support.

entries.name: Attitude Adjustment
entries: Characters can improve the attitude of the ssurran faction by one step if they offer Zoth'ess a worthy gift, examples of which are as follows:

items: At least 500 gp in coins, gems, or art objects
A magic item of uncommon rarity or better

entries.name: Assemble the Fleet!
entries: Each faction that joins the coalition brings a certain number of ships to it, as summarized in the Coalition Fleet table.

If the characters convince at least four factions to join the coalition, {@creature Vocath|LoX} decides their cause is worth supporting and telepathically reaches out to some of his mercane allies, who send additional ships. These ships come with their own {@item Spelljamming Helm|AAG|spelljamming helms} and crews. The mercane ships have crews pulled from different factions. The mercanes themselves stay out of the fight.
It takes ten days for the coalition fleet to assemble, during which time the characters can rest and make any final preparations before heading to Xaryxispace.

entries.caption: Coalition Fleet
rows: 5 {@vehicle Shrike Ship|AAG|shrike ships}, including the Skyrra
5 {@vehicle Lamprey Ship|AAG|lamprey ships}, including the Remora
3 {@vehicle Space Galleon|AAG|space galleons}, including the Tarrasque
2 {@vehicle Hammerhead Ship|AAG|hammerhead ships} (one crewed by humans, the other by thri-kreen) and 5 {@vehicle Squid Ship|AAG|squid ships} (each one crewed by members of a different faction)
6 {@vehicle Wasp Ship|AAG|wasp ships}, including the Gadabout
4 {@vehicle Scorpion Ship|AAG|scorpion ships}, including the Vrusk

entries.name: Red Dragon Rider
entries: From now on, the adventure makes no assumption about which ship the characters are traveling on, but it is important for the characters to be together.
A few hours after they return to the Astral Sea, the characters have the following encounter:

The silvery fog catches the light of distant stars and coalesces into clouds that vaguely resemble faces as inscrutable as they are enormous. Perhaps these are the visages of gods watching over you, or perhaps they are merely figments of the Astral Plane—stray thoughts given form.

None of that matters, however, as a distant roar draws your attention to one of the cloudy visages, from whose mouth emerges a large red dragon. Riding the dragon is a knight clad in golden armor, their face hidden behind a fearsome visor shaped like a dragon's scowling visage!
{@i Here ends part 3 of the adventure. Each character should gain a level before the next session.}

entries.name: Chapter 10: Space Invaders

entries: {@i After the Xaryxian Empire attacked their world, the characters journeyed to Doomspace and formed a coalition. With a fleet of ships accompanying them, they set out for Xaryxispace, encountering a red dragon and its rider along the way}!

Dagaz, a {@creature githyanki knight}, is hunting {@creature Mind Flayer||mind flayers} in the Astral Sea. Dagaz and her dragon mount fight only in self-defense and are, at best, a fleeting distraction. The real trouble begins when the characters enter Xaryxispace and make their way to the imperial citadel of the Xaryxian Empire, which is protected by a fleet of {@vehicle Star Moth|AAG|star moths}.

entries.name: Knight of Tu'narath
entries: A lawful evil {@creature githyanki knight} named Dagaz rides a male {@creature young red dragon}. These creatures begin the encounter 500 feet from the characters' ship.

Dagaz and the dragon are initially indifferent toward the characters. If the dragon is not attacked right away, it circles the characters' ship once as it identifies a safe place to land, then lands gently on the deck. Dagaz casts {@spell tongues} on herself and addresses the characters moments later:

The armored knight lifts the visor of her helm, revealing the stern visage of a githyanki. "I am Dagaz, a knight of Tu'narath," she says in a haughty tone. "By order of Vlaakith the Undying, Queen of the Astral Sea, I declare that you are guilty of the crime of trespassing. As your punishment, it is my solemn duty to decapitate your captain. So, which one of you dung-eaters commands this barge?"
After a beat, Dagaz smiles and adds:
"A bad joke on my part. I wish you swift passage through Her Majesty's realm. My dragon and I are hunting mind flayers. Have you seen any?"

If the characters attack the knight or the dragon, the dragon retaliates by burning their ship with its Breath Weapon. If she takes any damage, Dagaz uses {@spell misty step} to board the vessel and goes after whoever is responsible.

If the characters refrain from combat and inform Dagaz that they've encountered no mind flayers, she takes them at their word and bids them a safe journey to wherever they're going. If the characters inform Dagaz of their destination, she tosses one of them a vial containing {@item oil of sharpness} and says, "Give the Xaryxian Empire my regards." She and the dragon then fly away.

entries.name: Arrival in Xaryxispace
entries: When the characters enter Xaryxispace, read:
You emerge from the silver haze of the Astral Sea and enter a Wildspace system illuminated by a white star.

Using the {@item Wildspace orrery|AAG}, the characters can plot a course to the imperial citadel of the Xaryxian Empire, which is connected to Xaryxis by a beam of light 300 million miles long. The characters are 100 million miles (1 day's travel by spelljamming ship) from the imperial citadel when their fleet enters Xaryxispace. If the characters no longer have the {@item Wildspace orrery|AAG}, they can fly toward the star until they see the beam of light and follow it to the imperial citadel.
For a map of Xaryxispace and more information about this Wildspace system, see the "{@area Xaryxispace|130|x}" section immediately following this chapter.

entries.name: Attacking the Citadel
entries: When the characters come within 1 mile of the imperial citadel, read:

Ahead, you see an elegant, crystal-spired city built on the back of an asteroid shaped like a moth, with shipyards sprouting from its wings. Atop the moth's head stands a magnificent temple. A beam of light stretches from a crystal atop the temple toward the bright white star, Xaryxis.
An armada of crystal-winged ships patrols the region between your fleet and the citadel. The closest enemy ship is about a thousand feet away.

The Xaryxian armada is not expecting an attack. Allow the characters to decide whether they want to open the engagement at range or close to boarding distance. In either case, the Xaryxian ships are {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} at the beginning of combat.

entries.name: The Xaryxian Armada
entries: The enemy armada consists of thirty {@vehicle Star Moth|AAG|star moths}, each one crewed by an {@creature astral elf honor guard|BAM}, who serves as the captain; an {@creature astral elf star priest|BAM}, who serves as the ship's spelljammer; and eleven {@creature Astral Elf Warrior|BAM|astral elf warriors}. The armada's flagship, the {@i Xaryxia}, also carries an {@creature astral elf commander|BAM} named Vael, who commands the entire fleet. See {@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM} for the {@book astral elves' stat blocks|BAM|0|Bestiary}.

When the two fleets meet in battle, the {@i Xaryxia} singles out the characters' ship while the rest of the armada engages the other ships in the characters' fleet. The {@i Xaryxia} and the characters' ship are 1,000 feet apart at the start of the encounter.

Given the number of ships and combatants on both sides, it is impractical to track everyone's movements and actions. Instead, narrow the focus of the conflict to the characters' ship and the {@i Xaryxia}. In between actions, you can narrate glimpses of what's going on in the larger battle—for example, stray ballista bolts whizzing past the characters' ship or an aartuk lamprey ship clamping onto a passing star moth.

Although the Xaryxian ships are united in their determination to defend the imperial citadel, the crews have different political loyalties, as discussed in the "Loyalty to Xedalli or Xeleth?" sidebar.

entries.name: Loyalty to Xedalli or Xeleth?
entries: The crew of the {@i Xaryxia} is loyal to {@creature Prince Xeleth|LoX}, but not all ships in the Xaryxian armada share that loyalty. To determine the political leanings of another star moth's crew, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 1–3, the crew is loyal to Xeleth. On a roll of 4–6, the crew is loyal to Xedalli. Regardless of a crew's loyalty, no ship in the Xaryxian armada can be used to attack another Xaryxian vessel unless it has been commandeered by an enemy.

A character who shows Xedalli's {@item ring of shooting stars} to one or more crew members of a ship loyal to Xedalli can, with a successful DC 15 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, improve the attitude of that crew, changing it from hostile to indifferent, by claiming to be acting on Xedalli's behalf. Xedalli's ring looks no different from her brother's, but a successful check is enough to convince the crew that the ring was entrusted to the characters by the princess. An indifferent crew breaks off its attack on the characters' ship but won't aid the characters in any other way.

entries.name: Battle Losses
entries: Each round on initiative count 0, the Doomspace coalition and the Xaryxian armada each lose one ship and its crew, in addition to any ships and crews defeated by the characters. Keep track of how many ships are left in the battle at the start of each round.

entries.name: Here There Be Dragons
entries: Seven {@creature Young Solar Dragon|BAM|young solar dragons} (see {@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}), born in the fiery heart of Xaryxis, fly around the beam of light that extends between the imperial citadel to the star. After noticing the battle, they join the fray, arriving just as the characters finish dealing with Commander Vael's flagship:
Seven dragons with multicolored scales and gaseous wings slither through Wildspace with their mouths agape like hungry serpents. Two of them break off from the others and head toward your ship.
Two of the seven solar dragons fly toward the party's vessel while the remaining dragons harry other ships in the coalition fleet or scour the wrecks for treasure.

The two dragons are 1,000 feet from the characters' ship when they are spotted. Both dragons close the distance. One targets characters while the other targets the ship and its weapons. If either dragon is reduced to 50 hit points or fewer, it flees. The dragons also break off their assault if a character stands on the deck of their ship and brandishes Xedalli's {@item ring of shooting stars}; the dragons have been trained since birth not to harm anyone bearing such a ring.

entries.name: Final Approach
entries: Even if the characters survive the {@i Xaryxia} and the two solar dragons, it becomes obvious that the rest of their fleet is doomed. In response, they can fight on, surrender, or make a break for the citadel.
If the characters surrender to the astral elves or are defeated, read:

You watch as your allies lay down their arms and surrender. Now prisoners of the Xaryxian Empire, you are taken to the imperial citadel to face justice. Maybe this was your plan for getting into the citadel all along. Maybe not. Either way, all is not lost.
If the characters avoid capture and make a break for the citadel, read the following text instead:
The imperial citadel looms large, its crystal spires reflecting the light of Xaryxis. It is here, in the heart of the Xaryxian Empire, that you will decide the fate of your world.
{@i Here ends chapter 10.}

entries.name: Wildspace System: Xaryxispace
entries: Part 4 of the adventure takes place in a Wildspace system under the control of the Xaryxian Empire.

entries.name: Xaryxispace in a Nutshell
entries: Xaryxis is a white-hot star that is both the literal and figurative heart of the astral elves' empire. The astral elves discovered how to harness the star's power, using it to fuel their magic. When, after thousands of years of exploitation, Xaryxis's light began to dim, the astral elves began harvesting astral seeds from the star to tap the energy of other celestial bodies and use it to replenish the strength of their star.

Xaryxispace is a small Wildspace system, consisting only of its central star and three natural satellites, plus a floating citadel constructed by the astral elves of the Xaryxian Empire, who are the system's primary inhabitants. The Xaryxispace table and the accompanying diagram provide an overview of this system.

entries.caption: Xaryxispace
colLabels: Distance to Outer Edge of System
rows: Spherical earth body with one moon (Eysix)

entries.name: Locations in Xaryxispace
entries: The following locations are depicted on the map of Xaryxispace.

entries.name: Vaerduran
entries: This rocky, misshapen world once supported life, but its ecosystem was wiped out when it became the astral elves' first testing ground for their newly harvested astral seeds. Cracked and barren, this planet is now little more than a cinder.

entries.name: Rivus
entries: Another rocky world, Rivus escaped Vaerduran's fate because of its rich platinum deposits, which the astral elves mine. Although it appears desolate on the surface, Rivus bustles with activity belowground, where {@creature Umber Hulk||umber hulks}, {@creature Purple Worm||purple worms}, and other burrowing creatures make their lairs.

entries.name: Xaryndar
entries: Xaryndar is a lush, green planet that teems with life. The flora of the world grow to extraordinary size thanks to the light of Xaryxis, and many of the planet's most formidable creatures are various kinds of intelligent plants. Most of Xaryndar's elf population left long ago to be closer to their gods on the Astral Plane, but the planet still has a few settlements that cultivate and harvest the crystal-leaf trees used in the construction of star moths.

entries.name: Imperial Citadel
entries: The imperial citadel is the administrative heart of the Xaryxian Empire and is described more fully in the "Citadel Overview" section.

entries.name: Citadel Overview
entries: The imperial citadel is the seat of the imperial family, which includes Emperor Xavan and his heirs, {@creature Princess Xedalli|LoX} and {@creature Prince Xeleth|LoX}. The citadel is a mile-wide, floating platform of hewn stone shaped in the form of a moth. See the accompanying map for the citadel's layout.

The citadel, which has its own air envelope and gravity plane, is home to approximately 10,000 people, most of them astral elves. The few non-elves are diplomatic envoys to the court, traders, and skilled crafters whose work is esteemed by the emperor.

The imperial guard, which provides security within the palace and throughout the citadel, is composed of 150 {@creature Astral Elf Warrior|BAM|astral elf warriors} and 30 {@creature Astral Elf Honor Guard|BAM|astral elf honor guards} (see {@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}) of various alignments, with half that number on duty at any given time.

No structures are built on the underside of the citadel, which is dotted with natural rocky protrusions. On the topside, stone walls 20 feet thick and 40 feet high control access to the gardens, the imperial palace, the Great Orrery, and the docks. Sixty-foot-tall stone towers built into the walls are topped with ballistae and mangonels.

entries.name: Regions
entries: The citadel is made up of the following regions.

entries.name: Common Docks
entries: These docks are used by ships belonging to tradespeople, visitors, private citizens, and mercenaries. Much of the traffic at the common docks consists of cargo vessels delivering food and other supplies.

entries.name: Gardens
entries: The citadel's gardens are trimmed and cultivated to represent an idyllic vision of Xaryndar's forests. The greenery replenishes the citadel's air envelope and serves as a bucolic refuge. Discreet conversation away from the prying eyes of the court often takes place here.

entries.name: Great Orrery
entries: The Great Orrery is the center of scholarship in the citadel. Enclosed by high walls, the facility is built around a gigantic orrery of Xaryxispace. This magical and mechanical contraption features levitating models of the system's planets and moons, all orbiting a brightly glowing crystal orb that represents Xaryxis.

A lawful evil, astral elf {@creature archmage} named Magister Theraxana is here day and night, studying Wildspace systems that have been surveyed by astral elf explorers and looking for new worlds that can be exploited to keep Xaryxis burning bright.

A chamber beneath the Great Orrery contains a ring of twelve {@item Spelljamming Helm|AAG|spelljamming helms} joined together by crystal filaments. Theraxana and her fellow mages use these {@item Spelljamming Helm|AAG|spelljamming helms} to move the citadel across Wildspace and the Astral Sea, in accordance with the wishes of the emperor. All twelve helms are required to propel the citadel, which has a flying speed of 50 feet (5½ mph).

entries.name: High Quarter
entries: This region is where the palace's courtiers and trusted servants maintain their residences. A handful of shops and other establishments that cater to members of the court are also located here.

entries.name: Imperial Docks
entries: Only ships belonging to the imperial family—which includes the imperial navy as well as an assortment of pleasure craft—are allowed to dock here. Guards patrol the imperial docks constantly.

entries.name: Imperial Palace
entries: From the upper floors of this stone and crystal palace, the ruling family has a commanding view of the vista that stretches out below. Including courtiers, guards, and servants, over a thousand people are in the palace at any time.

entries.name: Low Quarter
entries: The citadel's laborers and servants have dwellings in the low quarter. Here, too, are relatively cheap lodgings for visitors.

entries.name: Military Quarter
entries: Members of the imperial navy and the imperial guard maintain residences in the military quarter. Most members of the guard can be found here when they are not on duty.

entries.name: Temple of Light
entries: The Temple of Light is where the light of Xaryxis is harnessed for the astral elves' use. Atop the temple is a giant crystal that receives and focuses the star's light and channels that energy into a pool in the center of the temple called the Astral Font, which powers the empire's most potent magic. Andavier, a lawful neutral {@creature astral elf star priest|BAM} (see {@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}), oversees the temple.
More information about the temple is presented in {@area chapter 11|14c|x}.

entries.name: Trade Quarter
entries: Most of the citadel's merchants and crafters live and work in the trade quarter. Much of the citadel's commerce takes place here, making it the liveliest area of the city. Well-appointed lodgings are also available for visitors with coin to spare.

entries.name: Chapter 11: Crowning Moment

entries: {@i Determined to save their world, the characters traveled to Xaryxispace with a fleet of ships at their command. But nothing could have prepared them for the armada of enemy ships and the host of solar dragons guarding the magnificent citadel of the Xaryxian Empire. Though the battle was lost, hope remains}!

The characters' arrival at the imperial citadel coincides with the funeral of Emperor Xavan. When Xedalli challenges her brother's claim to the throne and names the characters as her champions, the heroes must do battle with a {@creature zodar|BAM} (see {@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}) to decide who will rule as the next emperor.

entries.name: Arrival at the Citadel
entries: When the characters approach the imperial citadel, either as prisoners or in their own ship, read:

As your ship draws closer to the citadel, you can make out thousands of people in the streets. The crowds surround the temple at the citadel's peak. By comparison, the two docking platforms at the tail end of the citadel seem quiet.

Characters who have been taken prisoner by the astral elves are stripped of all visible weapons, but they are allowed to keep their armor and other gear. (The same is true for any nonplayer characters who are with them.) A character can conceal a light weapon on their person by succeeding on a DC 17 Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check.

Prisoners are delivered to the imperial docks, where they are met by six lawful neutral {@creature Astral Elf Warrior|BAM|astral elf warriors} and a lawful neutral {@creature astral elf honor guard|BAM} named Corelleth (see {@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM} for their stat blocks), all of whom are loyal to {@creature Princess Xedalli|LoX}:

Stepping onto a landing, you are met by seven armored figures, their faces hidden behind filigreed visors. Their leader takes a step forward and says, "I am Commander Corelleth. My orders are to deliver you to the Temple of Light to face the emperor's justice." The commander then orders your captors to return your weapons to you. "{@creature Princess Xedalli|LoX} sends her regards."

Weapons confiscated from the characters and their allies are promptly returned to them, after which Corelleth's squad leads the group through the streets of the citadel to the Temple of Light. If the characters flee from their escort, Corelleth's squad doesn't pursue, per Xedalli's instructions.
On the way to the temple, Corelleth gives honest answers to any questions the characters might have. The commander imparts the following information:

items: Following the death of Emperor Xavan, {@creature Prince Xeleth|LoX} has declared that his coronation will take place after the emperor's funeral.

{@creature Princess Xedalli|LoX} is being forced to attend her brother's coronation, even though it is the wish of many to see Xedalli and Xeleth coronated jointly, in accordance with their father's wishes.
If he becomes emperor, Xeleth will have the characters executed without a trial.

entries.name: Infiltrating the Citadel
entries: If the characters arrive at the citadel in their own ship, they can tell from a distance that the imperial docks are guarded, but the common docks are not.

entries.name: Landing at the Common Docks
entries: If they land at the common docks, the characters can disembark and enter the city without being seen by guards.

entries.name: Landing at the Imperial Docks
entries: If the characters land at the imperial docks or try to enter the citadel by any other method (such as rappelling down on ropes over the middle of the city), they are immediately confronted by Commander Corelleth's squad (see above), which tries to capture them and escort them to the Temple of Light.

entries.name: Exploring the City
entries: Characters who avoid or escape the attention of their escorts can move about the citadel as they see fit. Most of the city's inhabitants are too preoccupied with the emperor's funeral and {@creature Prince Xeleth|LoX}'s imminent coronation to take notice of the party. Any locals the characters talk to quickly turn the conversation to this topic, encouraging the party to get to the temple quickly before all the best vantage points are taken. The funeral for Emperor Xavan is a lengthy ceremony, which provides the characters with an opportunity to take a short rest before the final showdown in the Temple of Light.

entries.name: Temple of Light
entries: The interior of the Temple of Light is large enough to accommodate dozens of people, while hundreds more gather outside.

entries.name: Entering the Temple
entries: As the characters enter the temple, read:

Pushing your way into the temple through the crowd of onlookers, you see an elf priest presiding over the figure of the late emperor, whose body floats in an azure pool with a brilliant beam of light penetrating it from above. Flanking the priest are {@creature Prince Xeleth|LoX} and {@creature Princess Xedalli|LoX}. The prince is arrayed in regal splendor, his expression one of exultation, while Xedalli stands stiffly, regarding her brother with a look of utter loathing.
Silence fills the temple as the priest raises his arms and the emperor's body, shrouded in light, rises into the beam and disappears.

"The emperor has ascended!" the priest announces. "His spirit is one with the light of Xaryxis. As his firstborn heirs, {@creature Prince Xeleth|LoX} and {@creature Princess Xedalli|LoX} are both in line to rule, but {@creature Princess Xedalli|LoX} stands accused of treason. Are there any who would defend her claim?"

{@creature Prince Xeleth|LoX} is a chaotic evil {@creature astral elf aristocrat|BAM} with a {@item ring of shooting stars}. {@creature Princess Xedalli|LoX} is a chaotic neutral {@creature astral elf aristocrat|BAM}. If Xedalli died previously, the figure standing here is a clone (created using a {@spell clone} spell). Also present is Andavier, a lawful neutral {@creature astral elf star priest|BAM}, who is overseeing Emperor Xavan's ascension. Watching from the perimeter of the room are twelve {@creature Astral Elf Honor Guard|BAM|astral elf honor guards} of various alignments. See {@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM} for the {@book astral elves' stat blocks|BAM|0|Bestiary}.

If the characters don't speak up, Xedalli tries to mount her own defense, accusing her brother of trying to get rid of her and then fabricating the story of her sedition. It is obvious her words do not move the crowd, however. When Xeleth then tells of finding her engaged in a conspiracy to overthrow him, the crowd boos Xedalli and calls for Xeleth to be crowned emperor. Xedalli, in desperation, demands a chance to prove her innocence in a trial by combat—a request that Xeleth mocks:
"Only someone who bears one of the starlight rings can challenge for the right to rule," says the prince. "Where is your ring, dear sister?"
If she has entrusted her {@item ring of shooting stars} to the characters, Xedalli points in their direction, causing all eyes in the temple to fall upon them.

If the characters don't have the ring or refuse to present it, Xedalli loses her claim to the throne. Xeleth laughs, after which Andavier declares, "Xeleth is the rightful heir!" Skip ahead to the {@area "All Hail Emperor Xeleth!"|157|x} section.

entries.name: Defending Xedalli
entries: If the characters show that they have Xedalli's ring, they are entitled to defend the princess's claim to the throne. {@creature Prince Xeleth|LoX} is irritated and tries to refute their arguments. You can run this scenario as a tense series of verbal thrusts and parries, with Xedalli prompting the characters as needed to recount the various episodes of their mission and their grievances against the Xaryxian Empire, while Xeleth attempts to twist every point against them. Resolve this debate by having one of the characters—whichever one is leading the argument in favor of Xedalli's claim to the throne—make a DC 20 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check. If another skill seems more appropriate, use that skill instead. If the character's argument is genuinely persuasive or if other characters contribute to the argument, the check is made with advantage. If the check succeeds, the crowd is swayed in Xedalli's favor. If the check fails, the crowd is not swayed, which pleases Xeleth.

If the characters fail to convince the crowd of Xedalli's innocence, Xedalli resorts to challenging her brother to a trial by combat. If the characters turn the crowd's opinion against the prince, it is instead Xeleth who, seeing his status in danger, challenges Xedalli to combat. In either case, proceed to the "{@area Trial by Combat|152|x}" section.

If the characters attack Xeleth or otherwise try to rescue Xedalli by force, they find themselves up against overwhelming odds. Xeleth uses Starlight Step and {@spell fly} to evade their attacks, while the imperial guards do their best to subdue and apprehend the characters. If the characters are captured, Xeleth promises to have them executed as soon as the coronation is over. In the unlikely event that the party defeats Xeleth or drives him off, skip ahead to the "{@area All Hail Emperor Xedalli!|15a|x}" section.

entries.name: Astral Font
entries: The Astral Font is a 40-foot-diameter, 2-foot-deep pool of glowing, pale liquid fed by a 10-foot-diameter beam of harmless blue light, which streams down from an aperture in the ceiling 175 feet above. The Astral Font has the following magical properties:

items.name: Star Beam
items.entry: A creature that ends its turn in the beam of light is magically teleported to the radiant core of Xaryxis, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. (The {@creature zodar|BAM} is immune to this effect.) A creature that enters the star or starts its turn there takes 132 ({@dice 24d10}) radiant damage.

items.name: Starlight Spellcasting
items.entry: Water removed from the Astral Font glows faintly for 24 hours, shedding dim light in a 5-foot radius. A spellcaster who quaffs an ounce or more of the glowing water must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 24 ({@dice 7d6}) psychic damage. On a successful save, the creature gains the ability to cast one spell of their choice from the {@filter cleric spell list|spells|class=cleric} or the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard}. The chosen spell, which must be of 7th level or lower, uses the caster's spellcasting ability and requires no material components. Once the spell is cast, it fades from memory. A creature can gain only one such spell at a time and can't benefit from drinking the pool's water more than once every 24 hours.

entries.name: Trial by Combat
entries: Xedalli asks the characters to serve as her champions. If the characters accept, read:
Xeleth sneers. "Very well, sister, since you won't face me yourself, I, too, name a champion. Bring forth the zodar!"

The crowd gives out a collective gasp as the guards part ranks to make way for a creature clad head to toe in a suit of obsidian armor. As it floats toward you, you realize the armor {@i is} the creature.
The priest turns to face you. "The zodar has served the imperial family since the dawn of the empire. Its knowledge is vast, and its will is absolute. To the death!"
The characters must fight the {@creature zodar|BAM} (see {@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM}) on their own. See {@area "Running the Zodar"|155|x} below for more information about this creature.

The characters win the trial by combat if they reduce the zodar to 0 hit points. The zodar wins the battle if all the characters are at 0 hit points at the start of the zodar's turn or if the characters who are still standing concede defeat. The characters forfeit the match if any of them leaves the temple.

Xeleth, Xedalli, and Andavier move to the sidelines for their own safety, protected by royal guards. The audience also moves as far back as they can while preserving their front-row views of the battle.

entries.name: Xedalli's Favor
entries: If the characters swayed the crowd in favor of {@creature Princess Xedalli|LoX}, the princess leads the crowd in a chant before the battle begins. This uplifting tribute grants 20 {@book temporary hit points|PHB|9|Temporary Hit Points} to each of her champions.

entries.name: Running the Zodar
entries: The zodar tries to knock characters {@condition unconscious} instead of killing them. A character reduced to 0 hit points by the zodar is stable at 0 hit points. (The zodar saves its {@spell wish} spell for the {@area next chapter|160|x}.)
If the zodar is reduced to 0 hit points, it slumps in place, apparently inert.

entries.name: Aftermath
entries: This chapter's cliffhanger ending depends on who wins the trial by combat.

entries.name: All Hail Emperor Xeleth!
entries: If the characters are defeated by the zodar (as {@area described earlier|152|x} in the chapter) or fail to come to Xedalli's defense, read:
The crowd chants, "All hail Emperor Xeleth!"

Xeleth glowers at you. "Pathetic fools. Hurling yourselves into the void without the slightest inkling of who or what is out here. If you knew anything about the true nature of Wildspace, anything at all, you would have hidden from it in terror. Pity I can't destroy your world more than once."
{@i Here ends chapter 11.}

entries.name: All Hail Emperor Xedalli!
entries: If the characters are triumphant, read:
The priest's voice rings throughout the temple. "The zodar is defeated! All hail Emperor Xedalli!"
Xeleth lets out a strangled cry as his sister steps toward you, a wide smile on her face. "My ring, if you please."

If the characters return Xedalli's {@item ring of shooting stars}, she slides it onto her finger, clenches her fist, and gazes at the ring lovingly. If the characters refuse to return her ring or claim not to have it, she frowns and says, "No matter."

Whether or not Xedalli gets her ring back, she knows the characters' mission poses a threat to Xaryxispace (as explained in the next chapter) and concludes that the characters have outlived their usefulness. Read:
"As emperor, I must reward my champions for this triumph." Abruptly, Xedalli's smile turns into a sneer. "Guards, seize them!"
{@i Here ends chapter 11.}

entries.name: Chapter 12: Light of Xaryxis

entries: {@i The Xaryxian Empire bombarded the characters' world with astral seeds, which sprouted into crystal vines that began harvesting the planet's energy. Determined to save their world, the characters fought their way to the imperial citadel orbiting Xaryxis, where the next emperor of the Xaryxian Empire was declared}!

Regardless of which sibling—Xeleth or Xedalli—ascends to the Xaryxian throne, the new emperor orders the execution of the characters. Before that can happen, the {@creature zodar|BAM} intervenes on the party's behalf, using its {@spell wish} spell to restore the characters to full health.

entries.name: Dying Wish
entries: If the zodar was reduced to 0 hit points in the previous chapter's trial by combat, it regains 1 hit point now. At the same time, any {@condition unconscious} characters regain 1 hit point and wake up. If the characters did not engage in the trial by combat, the zodar floats into view immediately after either Xeleth or Xedalli is hailed as the new emperor.

Unknown to Xeleth or Xedalli, the zodar was tasked by a previous emperor to help bring about the empire's destruction if ever someone of corrupt heart ascended to the throne. The zodar believes that time has finally come. Read the following:

A resounding, supernal voice issues from the zodar, astonishing everyone. "TAKE THE RING OF STARS INTO THE HEART OF THE STAR WHERE IT WAS FORGED, AND YOUR WORLD WILL BE SAVED." At this pronouncement, golden light spills from the zodar's eyes and washes over you. The zodar then crumbles into dust.

As a result of the zodar's {@spell wish}, the characters regain all their hit points. Each character also receives the benefit of a {@spell greater restoration} spell. Seeing the characters invigorated in this way causes all the astral elves in the Temple of Light, including Xeleth and Xedalli, to wonder if the gods have forsaken them. Why else, as they see it, would the zodar, which has defended the royal family for eons, bestow such a gift on the empire's enemies?

The zodar's pronouncement tells the characters what they must do to save their world: hurl Xeleth's or Xedalli's {@item ring of shooting stars} into the heart of Xaryxis. Doing so not only destroys the star but also kills off the crystal vines threatening the characters' world.

Depending on how the previous chapter played out, the characters might have Xedalli's ring in their possession. If not, they will need to acquire that ring or obtain its twin, which is worn by Xeleth.

entries.name: Obtaining a Ring
entries: Andavier knows what will happen if the characters do as the zodar commands and makes these consequences known to everyone within earshot:
"Hurling a royal ring into the heart of Xaryxis will destroy the star and everything within one hundred million miles of it! That which survives will be plunged into darkness!"
Andavier orders the audience to evacuate the Temple of Light. The priest leads the exodus, leaving the characters and their allies alone with Xeleth, Xedalli, and the siblings' royal guards.

Xeleth and Xedalli are {@creature Astral Elf Aristocrat|BAM|astral elf aristocrats}, and at least Xeleth has his {@item ring of shooting stars}. Twelve {@creature Astral Elf Honor Guard|BAM|astral elf honor guards} (see {@book Boo's Astral Menagerie|BAM} for their stat blocks) stand ready to defend whichever sibling was named emperor in the previous chapter.

Whichever sibling was declared emperor in the previous chapter orders the guards to attack the characters, using the distraction to try to summon a solar dragon before joining the fray. Meanwhile, the other sibling casts {@spell fly} and tries to flee the temple.

entries.name: Life or Death
entries: When the characters have at least one {@item ring of shooting stars} in their custody, they must decide whether to destroy Xaryxis (to save their world and others like it) or to spare it (thus sealing their world's doom). If the characters seek the counsel of allies, use the following information to guide those conversations:

items.name: Commodore Krux
items.entry: The giff is adamant that Xaryxis be destroyed. He reminds the characters of the many worlds the Xaryxian Empire has wiped out of existence.

items.name: Flinch
items.entry: The hadozee recommends mercy for the astral elves. Flinch explains that his concern is not for the people of Xaryxispace but for the characters, because he has seen how the desire for revenge can bring great souls low—a remark that shames Krux into silence.

items.name: Grimzod Gargenhale
items.entry: Grimzod heartily endorses the destruction of Xaryxis, insisting that the astral elves have that and worse coming to them.

items.name: Starbough
items.entry: The destruction of Xaryxis would end the lives of all the creatures in Xaryxispace—an incalculable loss, in Starbough's estimation.

items.name: Topolah
items.entry: If blowing up the star is what it takes to save the characters' world, then {@creature Topolah|LoX} is all for it. She also observes that the opportunity to witness the death of a star is a once-in-a-lifetime event.

items.name: Warwyck Blastimoff
items.entry: Warwyck reminds the characters that good soldiers have fought and died to give the characters this chance at saving their world. He hopes they'll follow through.

entries.name: No Coming Back
entries: To destroy Xaryxis, someone bearing Xeleth's or Xedalli's {@item ring of shooting stars} must travel into the heart of the star, either by ship (a three-day voyage) or via the Astral Font's light beam (see {@area chapter 11|151|x}). It is, everyone realizes, a journey from which there is no coming back.

If no characters volunteer for this mission, {@creature Grimzod Gargenhale|LoX} does so. If the characters allow Grimzod to sacrifice himself, he says, "I hope you all appreciate the irony of a vampirate flying into the sun." He then entrusts his {@creature crawling claw} to {@creature Topolah|LoX}, saying, "Let it never be said that {@creature Grimzod Gargenhale|LoX} failed to give a lovely lady a hand."

{@creature Commodore Krux|LoX} is reluctant to entrust the {@item ring of shooting stars} to the vampirate. A character must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check to convince Krux to let Gargenhale have the ring and make this doomsday trip. Once he has the ring, Gargenhale enters the Astral Font's light beam. Moments later, he disappears and is gone forever.
If a character enters the heart of Xaryxis, describe their final moments as follows:
Unfettered radiance tears through your flesh as you are pulled into the star's blinding core.

entries.name: Death of a Star
entries: When Xaryxis is destroyed, read:
The star flares, becoming a thousand times brighter. Shock waves of multicolored energy expand outward from the collapsed star, threatening all in their path.

The exploding star destroys everything within 100 million miles of it, including the planet Vaerduran. Rivus and Xaryndar survive but are plunged into darkness. The surviving astral elves have no choice but to evacuate all life from Xaryxispace over the coming weeks and months before retreating to the Astral Sea. Amid the chaos, the characters and their NPC allies have enough time to board a ship and use its spelljamming helm to flee the system.

entries.name: Conclusion
entries: The characters' return voyage can be as eventful or uneventful as you like. As for the characters' world, its fate is inexorably bound with the fate of Xaryxis.

entries.name: Xaryxis Is Spared
entries: If Xaryxis was not destroyed, the characters return home to find their world on the brink of annihilation. As the planet begins to fracture, the characters might decide to help evacuate and resettle survivors on the other worlds of their system.

entries.name: Xaryxis Is Destroyed

entries.title: The destruction of Xaryxis causes the crystal vines to crumble. The heroes have saved their world!

entries: If Xaryxis was destroyed, the characters return home to find that the crystal vines that were choking their world have shattered and collapsed. Among the world's inhabitants, shock at the sudden reprieve has given way to relief and jubilation.

The destruction of Xaryxis forces what's left of the Xaryxian Empire to take refuge in the Astral Sea, where the astral elves still have numerous ships and strongholds. Xeleth and Xedalli had one clone apiece, making it likely that at least one sibling will survive the adventure with a hunger for revenge.

entries.name: Further Adventures
entries: This section provides a couple suggestions for how you can continue this campaign:

items.name: Beyond the Eye of Doom
items.entry: Is the Eye of Doom in Doomspace a gateway to a new Wildspace system? One or more NPCs encourage the characters to mount an expedition to discover what lies on the other side of the vortex.

items.name: Back to Bral
items.entry: If the characters return to the Rock of Bral, tales of their heroism travel quickly to the palace of Starhaven, where the characters are invited to meet Prince Andru. Perhaps the Bralian monarch has a quest for them!

entries: {@i The end}...?
